Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.threading.conditions

Class StateMachine<State>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.repeaters.BaseRepeater
        • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.threading.conditions.StateMachine<State>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Receiver<Transmittable>, Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Listener, Repeater, Transceiver
    public class StateMachine<State>
extends BaseRepeater
    A simple state machine with a single state that can be transitioned from one state to another and which allows a caller to wait for the machine to transition to a particular state.

    Example 

     enum State { UNBORN, LIVING, DEAD }

     [...]

 var person = new StateMachine(State.UNBORN);

     [...]

 KivaKitThread.run("Life", () ->
 {
     // Get born
     person.transitionTo(LIVING);

     // live life
     while (person.is(LIVING))
     {
         doSomething();
     }

     // then exit.
 });

 KivaKitThread.run("GrimReaper", () ->
 {
     // Wait a while
     Duration.years(random(101)).sleep();

     // then kill the person
     person.transitionTo(DEAD);
 });

 KivaKitThread.run("FuneralHome", () ->
 {
     // Wait for some business
     person.waitFor(DEAD);

     // then make some money.
     cashIn();
 });
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    ValueWatcher

    • Method Detail

      • is

        public boolean is​(State state)
        Returns:
        True if the current state is the given state

      • transition

        public boolean transition​(State from,
                          State to)
        If the state is equal to the 'from' state, transition to the 'to' state.
        Parameters:
        from - The expected state
        to - The desired state
        Returns:
        True if the state transitioned

      • transitionAndWait

        public boolean transitionAndWait​(State from,
                                 State to,
                                 State waitFor,
                                 Duration maximumWait)
        If the state is equal to the 'from' state, transition to the 'to' state and then wait for the 'waitFor' state. An example use case is to transition from RUNNING to STOPPING and then wait for STOPPED.
        Parameters:
        from - The expected state
        to - The desired state
        waitFor - The state to wait for if the transition is successful
        Returns:
        True if the state transitioned

      • transitionTo

        public State transitionTo​(State to)
        Transitions to the given state
        Parameters:
        to - The state to transition to
        Returns:
        The previous state

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor​(java.util.function.Predicate<State> desiredState,
                       Duration maximumWait,
                       java.lang.Runnable beforeWait)
        Waits until this state machine reaches the given state, running the beforeWait code before waiting
        Parameters:
        desiredState - The desired state
        maximumWait - The maximum amount of time to wait
        beforeWait - Code to run before waiting for the predicate to be satisfied
        Returns:
        True if the state was achieved, false if the operation timed out

      • waitFor

        public boolean waitFor​(State state,
                       Duration maximumWait)
        Waits until this state machine reaches the given state
        Parameters:
        state - The desired state
        maximumWait - The maximum amount of time to wait
        Returns:
        True if the state was achieved, false if the operation timed out
